messages.message:
when i tried to reproduce, yes the cancel button is disabled, and there’s a loading state

but the run was never cancelled
this bug exists on aihub-uat but not on preprod or prod :disappointed_relieved:

this bug was introduced last week https://github.com/instabase/instabase/pull/55171

the issue is that we need to pass `appId` into the args for the `APP_RUNS_TABLE_COLUMNS.status` column
cc @Travis

the same bug occurs if you try to click on the Cancel button in the My Hub page

previously, we would not show the Cancel button on the My Hub page (see the 2nd screenshot from preprod)
@Paul H should take a look I think.
i have the fix already (i was the original person who worked on BatchesTable and the cancel button)
nice, I’m happy to review when ready.

was there a particular reason to have both MyHub and ViewApp use `APP_RUNS_TABLE_COLUMNS` ?

i think they were different for a reason (cc @Weiming Wu)
I recently combined them.
There was a lot of overlap on them
Yea, I signed off on it because they seemed very similar and I couldn't think of any major complications if we combined them
I did blend some of the BatchesTable columns with the MyHub columns, but my testing of it all seemed copasetic.
ok i don’t think we should show the cancel button on the “My Hub” page, so i’ll keep the logic de-duplicated and just not show the cancel button in that case
agreed, thank you!

I think I originally had the status column in My Hub include cancel
But also that was more of my own decision than the designs (which only showed completed / failed cases) - there's nothing requiring us to keep it

i think we could technically show the button by relying on `deployedSolutionId` in each job

but since the Cancel button was just added last week to My Hub, i think that not showing the button will reduce possibility of bugs

we can revisit if people really want to cancel runs from My Hub / Workspaces

Ah I misremembered - I had it under the "actions" column, not status.
The cancel button under status is new
i don’t see any “Actions” column in My Hub on preprod, though?
It's a hidden column on the right, if you hover over it
ah i see

got it, i won’t touch that then

however, since the cancel button will show up on the right on hover, we shouldn’t show the “Cancel” button in the “Status” column as well, so i’ll just remove it from the “Status” column
Yep, it's entirely unnecessary
